question.body: Which one of the following structures does not allow light to pass through the eye to reach the retina?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is the external transparent part of the sclera.
Correct. The iris is the colored part of the eye and light cannot pass through it; the iris does change the diameter of the space in its center (pupil) that allows light to pass through.
Incorrect. This is an internal transparent structure.
Incorrect. This watery fluid is transparent.
Incorrect. This viscous fluid is transparent.

part.hint: Light will pass through solid and fluid transparent structures of the eye.
